thread.section_title: South China Morning Post - News feed
thread.title: 32 dead in Taiwan tourist bus crash
thread.title_full: 32 dead in Taiwan tourist bus crash | South China Morning Post

author: Staff Reporter
title: 32 dead in Taiwan tourist bus crash
text:
At least 30 people were killed in northern Taiwan when a tourist bus overturned on a highway on Monday night, Central News Agency reported.
A preliminary police investigation found that the crash might have been caused by speeding, the report said.
New Taipei City’s fire department said 17 passengers “showed no signs of life” at the scene of the crash, which occurred at about 9pm.

About 40 passengers were on the vehicle at the time but it was not known if any were from the mainland or Hong Kong.
The injured were rushed to hospitals for treatment.
The bus was returning to New Taipei City from Wuling Farm, a popular tourist attraction in Taichung.
